title: Swagger-UI spec validation cannot be disabled
body: ### Describe the bug I am using the OpenAPI extension in my application and I include the bundled `swagger-ui` in my deployment. I want to disable the spec validation of swagger-ui. I am using the YAML-based configuration, by the way. ```xml io.quarkus quarkus-smallrye-openapi io.quarkus quarkus-config-yaml ``` And I configured swagger-ui like this: ```yaml quarkus: swagger-ui: always-include: true validator-url: none ``` The docs of the extension mention the following: > [quarkus.swagger-ui.validator-url](https://quarkus.io/guides/openapi-swaggerui#quarkus-swaggerui_quarkus.swagger-ui.validator-url) By default, Swagger UI attempts to validate specs against swagger.ioâ€™s online validator. You can use this parameter to set a different validator URL, for example for locally deployed validators (Validator Badge). Setting it to either none, 127.0.0.1 or localhost will disable validation. However, when I run the application, it still renders the validation badge. Setting the value to `localhost` or `127.0.0.1` didn't work either. When I run the app in development mode locally, the validation seems disabled. The badge does not appear. ### Expected behavior The spec validation is disabled when the value of `validator-url` is set to either `none` or `localhost` or `127.0.0.1`. ### Actual behavior The validation is executed despite those values being set. ### How to Reproduce? _No response_ ### Output of `uname -a` or `ver` _No response_ ### Output of `java -version` _No response_ ### GraalVM version (if different from Java) _No response_ ### Quarkus version or git rev 2.8.2.Final ### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`) Apache Maven 3.8.4 ### Additional information _No response_
